text: Stéphane Maurice Dion (born 28 September 1955) is a Canadian diplomat and former politician. He served as Minister of Foreign Affairs in the Cabinet headed by Justin Trudeau from 2015 to 2017. He was a Member of Parliament of Canada for the riding of Saint-Laurent—Cartierville in Montreal since 1996. He was the leader of the Liberal Party of Canada and the Leader of the Opposition in the House of Commons of Canada from 2006 to 2008. Since 2017 he has been ambassador to the European Union and Germany. ==References== Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:Ambassadors of Canada Category:Members of the House of Commons of Canada from Quebec Category:Government ministers Category:Politicians from Quebec City Category:Privy Councillors (Canada) Category:Leaders of the Opposition (Canada)
